newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU sees 1996/97 sugar export target within reach.
newsitem.headline: EU sees 1996/97 sugar export target within reach.

text.p: The European Union's 1996/97 sugar export target could be achieved following a recent upsurge in trade demand, Commission officials said on Tuesday.
With three more tenders before the current export campaign closes on July 30, the EU still has 232,000 tonnes of sugar to export to meet its target.

"It could still be done. We have the technical possibility to complete the programme," a Commission official said, noting that 69,000 tonnes of exports were approved last week and 58,700 tonnes the week before.
In line with efforts to cut costs, Wednesday's meeting of the EU sugar management committee will be very short with only one official from each EU member state and fewer interpreters.
Short meetings will be held every second week, the official, said, adding that the austerity drive also affected other EU management committees.
But the official stressed that in response to trade requests, the weekly EU sugar export tender will continue to be held on Wednesdays, starting at 1030 GMT. --Brussels newsroom +322 287 6830
